page.title: 11DAIRY FARMING
page.content: There are four dairy farms in our area. One of the farms is very near to the school and they keep Friesian and Ayrshire cattle for milking. Another farm in our area also keeps Friesians and on the farm where I live, the farmer keeps about ninety Friesians in his herd. He also uses the animals for breeding purposes and there are about thirty calves this summer. The farmer can milk five cows at one time and the milk which is produced is cleaned and goes into a big tank at the farm. Then a large tanker lorry comes to collect the milk and it is taken to Aberdeen where it is used to produce milk products such cream, cheese, butter and yoghurt or is sold as milk. We are still buying our milk in pint measures but it is to be changed to litres eventually.
